Author: rtimothyedwards_19428
Content: FYI:  I have started work on a GF180MCU "openframe" design.  Hopefully I will get it (and an example user project using the 3.3V logic and the 3.3V SRAM) finished in time for the tapeout.

Author: 246tnt
Content: @Tim Edwards I want to also try and submit a TT variant using the split IO so any example of how to do that will be welcome üôÇ

Author: rtimothyedwards_19428
Content: @tnt :  I will be pushing everything to a repository as soon as I have done enough work on it that I know I won't have to replace everything wholesale on every update.  Right now I have it in a half-finished state and using it as a reference would be highly misleading.  Hopefully by end of day today or tomorrow I will have knocked down most of the items on my "to do" list.

Author: tholin
Content: It looks like I won‚Äôt be able to test my DACs for VGA output at their full range. TT demos only do 2 bits per channel of color depth, while the DACs are capable of 12 bits per channel.

Author: tholin
Content: Though anything about 8 bits per channel would be overkill.

Author: urish
Content: I think @algofoogle (Anton Maurovic) had a demo for his own DAC that can do 8bpc

Author: urish
Content:
and there's a variant of the tt logo screensaver which reads a bitmap from the ROM that can be easily adjusted to 8bpc

<https://github.com/urish/tt-rom-vga-screensaver>

Author: urish
Content: basically need to edit `convert.py` and remove the parts that downscales from 8bpc to 2bpc, and extend the ROM word length from 6 bits to 24 bits

Author: _luke_w_
Content: I have a GBA-ish-capable PPU that's currently hooked up to SPI LCD only. Pretty easy to knock together VGA timing generation. Can your DAC tristate its output @Tholin? It would have to share with digital pads (we have combined digital bidi + analogue pads right?)

Author: _luke_w_
Content: It would be RGB555 320x240, with 480p60 timings, so only a 12ish MHz pixel clock. Not sure if that is an interesting test for you.

Author: _luke_w_
Content: For VGA signal levels without an external buffer I would probably just tie off the 3 MSBs of the DAC code input (assuming it's rail-to-rail) and drive bits `8:4` with RGB555 components

Author: _luke_w_
Content: no worries. I'm a bit tight on IOs due to the external parallel SRAM üôÇ

Author: _luke_w_
Content: Um. I mean I guess I could replace my audio PWM outputs with a DAC, and then steal my one unassigned GPIO as the third RGB component ü§î  then I could afford 3 analog pads
